name: Reverse Bar Curl
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the bar with a pronated grip (palms facing away from you).

2. Hold the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart or slightly wider.

3. Rest your forearms on a flat bench to support your shoulders and keep your body straight.

4. Curl the bar up towards your chest, keeping your upper arms still, while squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

5. Lower the bar back down to the starting position by extending your elbows.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on a smooth and controlled motion throughout.
short_summary: Reverse Bar Curl is an isolation exercise that targets the upper arms, specifically the biceps, from different angles than traditional curls.
